item.title: Report E-2023090445
item.description:
Report E-2023090445

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 8, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint (UN1263) were damaged by a skid and released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents, absorbent pads and cleaners to the paint primer-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, impacted pallets and absorbent pads were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal. Damaged pails were patched up and over-packed into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023090271
item.description:
Report E-2023090271

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN3272 Disperbyk-161 release from a 55-gallon steel drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 53-gallons of material released to a 58’ x 10’ area of the concrete lot below the dock and a 15’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas and then collected into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The impacted trailer, concrete lot, and trench drain that flows to the onsite OWS were all pressure washed. All impacted water and skimmed material from the trench drain were collected and containerized into an additional 55-gallon metal drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: One of the bottles has a crack in it. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: place bottle with the crack facing up.

item.title: Report X-2023081580
item.description:
Report X-2023081580

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package appeared okay when being processed. About 2 hours later it was brought to QAs attention that the package was leaking due to a broken/loose cap. DescribePack: Cap was loose causing the contents to leak over the interior of the box and other contents. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined tote for qualified evaluation by QA.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: According to pre-load personnel, package arrived in a trailer on its side. Leakage occurred in transit, one of the jugs caps was loose and leaked out. contents soiled a small portion of the floor of the trailer but was cleaned up. DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: contents were placed in a tub to prevent further leakage

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WRAPPED IN PLASTIC BAGS

  • Description: During loading of a tarped roll-off box at the shippers on-site staging area, approximately 10 gallons of liquid material spilled over the tailgate. item.title: Report X-2023081158
item.description:
Report X-2023081158

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-13
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023081158 SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: LOOSE SAFETY CAP ALLOWING LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR SOILING OTHER BOTTLES. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET PACKAGE WAS TAKEN OUT OF THE SYSTEM FLOW AND PLACED IN LINED TOTE. CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER LIQUID RELEASE FROM OCCURING AND PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING. 2. X-2023081160 SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: NO INNER PACKAING ALLOWING MOVEMENT THIS ALLOWED LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR FROM LOOSE CAP AND FAILED SEAL. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX WAS TAKEN OUT OF THE SYSTEM FLOW AND PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report I-2023080016
item.description:
Report I-2023080016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: EAST LIVERPOOL
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The back gate of a parked dump trailer was partially opened to check for the presence of a liner. The operator was unaware that the trailer contained waste materials. After opening, waste materials were released from the gate onto the parking lot. The gate was closed with assistance of a fork truck, which stopped the release. Released materials were cleaned up promptly using onsite resources and placed into containers for subsequent management.
